From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To configure the address to which status email is to be sent and the outgoing email server, use the **autoupgrade status email** command in global configuration mode. To disable status email, use the **no** form of this command.
CLIs: no autoupgrade status email [ recipient [ <email-address> ] ] [ smtp-server [ <smtp-server> ] ]

ParaDef.Info: The address to which the Cisco IOS Auto-Upgrade Manager (AUM) status is to be sent.
The outgoing email server to which the AUM email is sent.
The email address to which the AUM status is to be sent.

Examples: The following example shows how to configure the address to which status email is to be sent:
Router(config)# autoupgrade status email recipient tree@abc.com
Router(config)# autoupgrade status email smtp-server smtpserver.abc.com
ExtraInfo: Use this command to configure the email-address where AUM status email can be sent.
